3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:14): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: so if you can specify xywh for any image/* type that'd be cool

040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (00:15): the challenge is: you can create a URL to a png or jpg or mpeg or ogg or anything that has a xywh and/or time offset it in, but you cannot guarantee that that URL will be resolved by the server or client
7b9920d3e896b22057673a1c887015a7 (00:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: btw, in the spirit of whatwg naming conventions, perhaps call EventSource something like WebStream? :-)
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (00:16): the actual splicing will still need to be done by some software
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: yeah, I guess that's the disadvantage there
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:16): 7b9920d3e896b22057673a1c887015a7: i was hoping for a better name... not sure WebStream is it, we have other plans for the concept of "streams"
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:16): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: we can't use CSS's typical "fails to parse" fallback mechanism
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (00:16): all you can do is provide a scheme - then the conformant implementations can come over time
7b9920d3e896b22057673a1c887015a7 (00:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: really, what do you have in mind there?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (00:17): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I think we're planning a scheme for making sure there is feedback on whether the URL resolved or not

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:17): 7b9920d3e896b22057673a1c887015a7: streams of video from one server plugged into a <video>, streams from a local camera plugged into an XHR to a server, or into a WebSocket to a server, that kind of thing
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (00:17): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: so the fallback would be to return the full resource
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: yeah, that wouldn't work well for CSS, since we'd want to trigger CSS's parse-time fallback system
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:18): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: but we can think about that some more on our end :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (00:19): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: I'm glad to hear someone's working on this
